Solar Power Plant Intentionally Keeps Design Defects Solar Power Plant Intentionally Keeps Design Defects Mitsui Chemicals runs a solar power plant for verification at its Mobara Factory 2015/09/09 18:43 Kenji Kaneko 
Mobara City, Chiba Prefecture, is known as Japan's largest natural gas production area. Mitsui Chemicals Inc's Mobara Branch Factory is located near the center of the city. 
As you enter the main gate of the factory and move forward into the site, you will reach a medium-scale solar power plant surrounded by a brown fence. This is the "Mitsui Chemicals Mobara Solar Power Plant" constructed by Mitsui Chemicals (Fig. 1). Mitsui Chemicals is the power producer and is also engaged in its operation and maintenance. Fig. 1: "Mitsui Chemicals Mobara Solar Power Plant" built by Mitsui Chemicals (source: Nikkei BP) 
Polycrystalline silicon type (720 units) and CIS chemical compound type (960 units) solar panels were set up and tilted to 10Â°. The total capacity is 335kW. The polycrystalline silicon type is a product of Yingli Green Energy Holding Co Ltd while the CIS chemical compound type is a product of Solar Frontier KK. PV inverters were manufactured by Toshiba Mitsubishi-Electric Industrial Systems Corp (TMEIC).
